body: The first "Buy Nothing Day" is organized as a protest against the over-consumption for which Black Friday stands by Ted Dave, who creates a piece in Adbusters magazine. (The Georgia Straight)
title: "Buy Nothing Day" is born

body: Thirty-four-year-old Walmart employee Jdimytai Damour was trampled to death as customers fought their way into the store on Black Friday. (N.Y. Times)
title: Store employee trampled

body: The National Retail Federation issues a news release touting the rise of Cyber Monday as "one of the biggest online shopping days of the year." (shop.org)
title: Cyber Monday debuts

body: A Walmart customer in Porter Ranch used pepper spray on a crowd of shoppers, causing minor injuries to about 20 people. (Yahoo!)
title: Customer uses pepper spray on fellow shoppers

body: A Black Friday shopper was shot by armed robbers outside a San Leandro Walmart superstore. (KPCC)
title: Man shot outside San Leandro Walmart
caption: Robyn Beck/AFP/Getty Images

body: An elderly woman and nine others were injured when shoppers chased after prize-filled balloons dropping from the ceiling at the Del Amo Fashion Center in Torrance. (ABC7)
title: Rush for prize-filled balloons leads to injuries

body: Philadelphia Police Department calls the day after Thanksgiving Black Friday — because of traffic jams and overcrowded sidewalks — as downtown stores offer discounted prices for shoppers. (ABC News)
title: Black Friday Begins?

body: Wal-Mart, Toys "R" Us, Target and other retailers begin opening to consumers late on Thanksgiving evening. (KPCC)
title: Black Friday moves into Thanksgiving
caption: Matthew Staver, Bloomberg/Getty

body: Wal-Mart workers took part in a series of demonstrations outside stores on Black Friday. (KPCC)
title: Wal-Mart workers protest on Black Friday 2012

body: The federal OSHA recommends that retailers have a crowd management plan in place to avoid injuries to or deaths of customers. (OSHA)
title: OSHA weighs in
caption: OSHA

body: Layaway — a staple of the pre-easy credit days —- makes a return at major retail chains as a remedy to the nation's financial crisis. (Globe and Mail)
title: Layaway Returns
caption: Cornell University
